thig5.9:1.1: My hair mown off, covered in mud,
thig5.9:1.2: I used to wander wearing just one robe.
thig5.9:1.3: I saw fault where there was none,
thig5.9:1.4: and was blind to the actual fault.
thig5.9:2.4: at the fore of the mendicant Saṅgha.
thig5.9:3.1: I bent my knee and bowed,
thig5.9:3.2: and in his presence raised my joined palms.
thig5.9:4.1: “I’ve wandered among the Aṅgans and Magadhans,
thig5.9:4.3: I have eaten the almsfood of the nations
thig5.9:4.4: free of debt for fifty years.”
thig5.9:5.1: “O! He has made so much merit!
thig5.9:5.2: That lay follower is so very wise.
thig5.9:5.3: He gave a robe to Bhaddā,
thig5.9:5.4: who is released from all ties.”
